intro: Stenanthera neurosericea, commonly known as the woolly rock orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy, silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom during the cooler months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
